intro: Platea griffithiana, commonly known as the Indian star-anise. It is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent, characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers and aromatic seeds. The plant belongs to the family Rutaceae and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its leaves are usually oval and have a slightly rough texture, while its stems are woody and branched. The fruit, which resembles a star, is used in traditional medicine and has a distinct, pungent aroma.
